author: duanqn
body:
<!--

For Windows PowerShell 5.1 issues, suggestions, or feature requests please use the following link instead:
Windows PowerShell [UserVoice](https://windowsserver.uservoice.com/forums/301869-powershell)

This repository is **ONLY** for PowerShell Core 6 and PowerShell 7+ issues.

- Make sure you are able to repro it on the [latest released version](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases)
- Search the existing issues.
- Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- Refer to the [known issues](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/known-issues-ps6).

-->

I was following the documentation on [this page](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/scripting/install/installing-powershell-core-on-linux?view=powershell-7.1) to install Powershell for Ubuntu. But I got a 404 error when trying to download the Microsoft product GPG key.

## Steps to reproduce

```powershell
wget -q https://packages.microsoft.com/config/ubuntu/18.04/packages-microsoft-prod.deb
```

## Expected behavior

Downloads Microsoft product GPG keys

## Actual behavior

wget returns 404 error

## Environment data

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```none

```

comments.author: JAK1047
comments.body:
Looks like at the time there was a major outage for packages.microsoft.com

https://github.com/dotnet/core/issues/6381#issuecomment-862858197

comments.author: duanqn
comments.body: @JAK1047  Thanks for the info. I've verified that the command is now working, so I closed this issue.

title: 404 error on downloading Microsoft product GPG keys
